p: CFEE had a scavenging effect on mature biofilms formed by E. coli K-12 and P. aeruginosa PAO1 ( Figure 5). Untreated by CFEE, mature biofilms had a higher bacterial density and were thicker than those treated with CFEE. When the mature biofilms were treated with 200 μg/mL CFEE, the biofilms become thin and loose. Treatment with 400 μg/mL CFEE almost completely destroyed all mature biofilms formed by both E. coli K-12 and P. aeruginosa PAO1. This was consistent with early measurements of biofilm productions in this text.
